body.description: Susan Count Novelist Susan Count writes for the joy and entertainment of young readers. She is an award-winning author of the Dream Horse Adventures Series and Texas Boys Adventures. While Susan writes stories packed with adventures, the stories are deeper than fun with horses. The characters struggle with real issues, explore life's challenges, and learn to overcome what threatens to hold them back - with a little help from a friend. Award Winning Author Engaging Series for Young Girls and Boys Lifelong equestrian and servant to a Rocky Mountain Horse

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Compelling - Wholesome - Genuinely Touching DREAM HORSE ADVENTURES for GIRLS ages 9-14 Mary's Song - A girl with grit. A lame foal destined for destruction.Selah's Sweet Dream - A girl with a dream. A horse with ATTITUDE.Selah's Painted Dream - A girl on a mission. The horse is the answer.Selah's Stolen Dream - One girl’s victory is another’s tragic defeat.

Mary's Song Selah's Sweet Dream Selah's Painted Dream Selah's Stolen Dream Dream Horse Adventures Series The Firefly Warriors Readers Age 9 - 12 9 - 12 9 - 12 9 - 14 9 - 14 9 - 12 Print Length 122 198 202 264 537 200 Paperback ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Hardback ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Kindle ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Audio Book ✓ ✓

DREAM PONY RIDERS for GIRLS ages 8 - 12 Abby's Pony Love Desperate to be near horses, a hopeful twelve-year-old girl with no horse experience begs for a job at a stable. Then she falls in love with a beautiful but mischievous pony, only to have it bought by another family. Abby’s heart aches when her barn job becomes helping the new owner learn to ride the best pony ever. Can her faithful heart let go of what never belonged to her? Lily Makes A Way A young girl’s ability to keep her pony is threatened by financial stress on her family. The strain intensifies when the pony is injured requiring expensive treatment. Even if Lily could afford it, China might never walk again. Is mild-mannered Lily strong enough to make the difficult choices? What if that means letting go of her adored pony? Brooke's Win-Win Pony When her world crashes, a devastated girl must move to Texas where she finds comfort in cupcakes, donuts, and a neglected pony. But as her confidence blossoms, Brooke’s claim on the pony is challenged, threatening to shatter her life again.

Susan Count, Author, with her horse. Series Lessons Even if you've never been enchanted by a horse, you'll love the Award-Winning Dream Horse Adventures Collection. "Read this series only if you want to feel happy!" It's engaging, inspiring, full of angst and suspense plus exuberant joy. Character Growth Overcoming Obstacles Perseverance Coming of Age Susan Count Novelist Susan Count writes for the joy and entertainment of young readers. She is an award-winning author of the Dream Horse Adventures Series and Texas Boys Adventures. While Susan writes stories packed with adventures, the stories are deeper than fun with horses. The characters struggle with real issues, explore life's challenges, and learn to overcome what threatens to hold them back - with a little help from a friend. Award Winning Author Engaging Series for Young Girls and Boys Lifelong equestrian and servant to a Rocky Mountain Horse

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars BEST Reading Series with my daughter! Susan Count is an AWESOME author!!
reviews.reviewText: If your reader loves horses, this is hands down, our favorite author! Susan Count writes so fluidly, with such realism, it transports BOTH adult and child into the story! Grandma gave us our first Susan Count book, Selah's Sweet Dream. We actually waited on this particular book (Mary's Song) due to the content, but purely for personal reasons - the content is clean and appropriate even for younger readers as well as older, and my daughter started reading these when she was 6 or 7 because she is an advanced/avid reader - but these are PERFECT to encourage the slower reader to practice and advance quickly! You will not be disappointed! I actually was sad when my daughter sped through it without me! hahaha!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Horse crazy Grand daughter loves it!
reviews.reviewText: great book for the horse crazy kid in your life. Hint? There are a lot of them !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ~~hope sprouts from the dark~~
reviews.reviewText: i loved thos book so much it just made my heart burst with how much she was willing to sacrifice to save illusion. And how she travels to destin florida. We actually went there once and if your having trouble picturing it i totally recommend going there. Anyway... Such a great book loved it so much i can see why riding was so helpful to her it helps strenghthen me too.p.s. i know i keep saying this but it was one of the best books i ever read! LOVED IT SOOOOOOOO OOOOOOOO MUCH

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars All the things I love in a book.
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful book for any animal lover, especially for a child or adult who has something in life they must overcome to fulfill their dreams. Guess that pretty much includes us all.Live is full of goals which we must learn to pursue if we really want to achieve our goals. Life is not easy but it is truly very very good. Work, learn, enjoy, and laugh and trust God that he is pursuing His goal of helping us live the best life possible and joining us in an even better world to come.Here's a positive beautiful book of love, determination, friendship and our relationships with people and animal friends. Read this only if you enjoy feeling happy!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars ~~ Life in a wheelchair but not giving up ~~
reviews.reviewText: Due to a virus, Mary (12) is in a wheelchair, unable to walk. The year is 1952. Her father, determined to find a cure, is a little over-protective. Mary enjoys sketching the horses in the field next door. Unable to attend school thus having a private tutor, Mary is thrilled when her next door neighbor, Laura (12), comes over to say "Hello". Laura's parents are the opposite of Mary's dad, not taking much notice of Laura at all. (Mary's mother has been dead for several years.) Laura's mother is more concentrated on her equitation.Buggy rides! What fun for a girl who has always dreamed that she will ride. What's so special about the filly, Illusion? Why do the girls have to come up with a scheme to save her? Is there a cure for Mary?WARNING: Some parts of this story give sad impressions of what may happen. If you have a sensitive child there may be tears before the end!Book has a good ending. There is no cliff hanger although it does leave you wanting to read the next one. The writing is okay. I found it a little stilted at times BUT I am an adult. A child reading this would likely not sense this at all. The book is clean, NO bad language or any inappropriate behavior. For those who want to know, the girls do pray once in a while when things get tough and they do not know what to do.I downloaded this book onto my Kindle. I was not required to write a review but chose to do so. Thanks, Liz

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for young girls who love horses.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my nine-year-old daughter and she wanted to leave a review she said "Your book was amazing I completely loved it I can't wait to see the next book and find out what happens I love the idea of the girl Mary and the bond between the horses and Mary and she never stopped trying to save the horses what is the best book I've ever read thank you so much for writing it!"

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Students enjoyed this book!
reviews.reviewText: Growing up riding and showing, I always loved books about horses. This one did not disappoint!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2016
reviews.reviewText: Heartwarming story about a young crippled girl, Mary and her dream of riding a horse. She falls in love with a lame foal in the neighbors pasture and is determined to save its life. Mary and her new best friend, Laura, devise ways to raise money for the foals surgery. As their friendship grows they have may amusing adventures together all while the miracle of healing is happening to both Mary and the foal. The story is also filled with the tender love of a father for his daughter and his dream that she will walk again. Susan Count's beautifully written story of love, hopes and friendship is sure to captivate the heart and imagination of any young girl who's dream it is to ride a horse. A "must" for parents/grandparents to add to their child/grandchild's reading list.
Sweet book, I bought it for my granddaughter. She loves it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 13, 2018
reviews.reviewText: In 1950s America, a girl afflicted by a virus that made her unable to walk (we are not told details, but it doesn't seem to be polio) sits on her father's fine porch and wishes for a horse. Specifically, one of the Morgan foals next door, Illusion, which was born with a club foot. If Illusion could be treated and saved - which is by no means certain - maybe even a lonely girl like Mary could learn to walk as well.The characterisation is finely done and we learn the strengths of determination, friendship and science. I particularly like the references to books of the day. One of the best sequences for me is when the daughter of the horse breeders, Laura, resolves one problem after another by applying what skills and lessons she and her horses have learned. Young readers, especially girls, will learn a great deal and enjoy the adventure. Adult horse lovers will like the unusual story too.This is an unbiased review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 6, 2017
reviews.reviewText: What a sweet little story. I hadn't realised this was written for youngsters aged twelve or less. Nevertheless, being a lover of horses, I enjoyed it. The author certainly has a great knowledge of all things equine.The young heroin Mary is disabled. She lives on a farm with her father. Most days he would carry her into a field and she would sit on a blanket in the shade of a large tree and draw the mares and foals in the adjacent field.She falls in love with one of the foals, who also has a serious problem with it's leg, and is destined to be put down as nothing can be done about it. However, Mary has other ideas.A lovely inspiring story for all youngsters who love horses.
Not happy with the condition of this book at all. This was supposed to be a Christmas gift and the book cover was all bent/ creased.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 10, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: A surprising story with a great storyline.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this book as I love horses. To my surprise I read it within two days. It was that type of book. Mary and Laura from two different backgrounds formed a bond to help a foal who is in danger. The problems they encounter are real, their solutions are unusual for two young girls but the writing style is strong and Susan's strong characters make the sweet story flow. I recommend this to parents of girls of nine years and upwards particularly if their daughters love animals.
